author: parchioso
title: Wedge Stickers...!
review:
I am disappointed with this set, I think the designer did not try the best to make this starfighter looks good, I put Ahsoka's starfigher and compare them side by side, I notice that there are fewer stickers, less attention to details, and even no missiles made available to Plo Koon. And the most annoying thing is, the wedge is not printed and is now decorated by stickers!

 

So if you got Plo Koon already, may be the only thing you really want from the set is the new R7-D4, but as a Starfighter collector, I would get it even I do not rate it good, it is just disappointing to see how Lego manage the product design for this set.

 

You can see pictures putting Ahsoka's starfigher along side with this starfighter at:
http://brickand.me/2010/06/20/HowComePloKoonsStarfighterUsesStickerWedge.aspx

author: frostlass
title: Great set!
review:
I got this set at K-mart For the price of $24.99. A little overpriced but it is still good. Now to the details.

Minifigs: You get two Minifigs. You get Plo Koon and you also get the rare R7-D4 that you can only find in this set. But you can find Plo Koon in lego set 7676 (Republic Gunship).

Structure: Now, the starfighter itself is pretty cool. However, my Plo Koon can fit in the cockpit. You can also eject Plo koon out of the cockpit with the little ball on the bottom. Same back details, nice and chunky like Ahsoka's starfighter, and best of all, it's blue! Nice new gun details, new place to store lightsaber even.

There is one small flaw with this set though. IT HAS STICKERS! No one likes stickers, right?

Overall, I give it a 4.8/5!

author: demasoni
title: A nice little set
review:
I picked this set up today at Walmart for $34.86 CDN. Pricey for its size but Lego is expensive in Canada so i'm use to it.

 

As for the set itself i really like it. It has good detail to it and looks really nice in the blue and white color they made it. Plo Koon is a cool figure to have and that's really why i wanted this set. He can eject out which i thought is a cool feature.

This set makes a nice addition to my Star Wars collection and i think you will enjoy it too.

author: jefferson
title: Awesome lego set for 2010
review: this set is the best set i got first it was my first starfighter its awesome because it has a rare minifig or jedi plo koon then a new driod r4-p6 i think you should buy this set mabye 2 but it comes a part if you hold it in the back but in the front no.

author: ssjherby2
title: Another thought
review:
Building experience: I found building this set to be a very good experience.  The set came together well and looks good when made.  As i was building it i saw the "fun" gimmick isn't fun.  The mini fig can't sit in place.  

Parts:  There lego bricks what can i say.  The use of stickers needs to stop, but they are used just so so over all.  

Playability: Well like i said the mini fig can't sit, so that take away form the playability.  

Value for $: is fine.

author: Jarod98
title: 8093-1: Plo Koon's Jedi Starfighter
review:
I just got this set today at Toys "R" Us, and I am very pleased with it. For starters, the minifigs in this set are very rare. Plo Koon can only be found in the '7676-1: Republic Attack Gunship', and R7-D4 is exclusive to this set. The ship itself is nice as well, but Lego overdid it with the stickers (just print the designs on the bricks), and it lacks missiles (a real ripoff). Plus, if you want it because it can 'launch' Plo Koon out of the cockpit, forget it, I can barely shoot him out of the cockpit and when I do he rolls off the wings. On the other hand the landing gear is good, and I like the way Plo Koon fits in the cockpit. I'm also glad that Lego gave us a place to put Plo Koon's Lightsaber.I had a great building experience, and the parts were great. It does lack in playability since there are no droids, and the price should be $19.99 instead of $24.99. Overall, I give it a 4.5, which rounds to 5, so it was still well worth it, plus I got a Chrome Stormtrooper free!

Great set!

author: Carl
title: Pretty Cool
review:
This is a pretty cool set. It includes cool blue pieces and awesome Plo Koon minifig. My brother got the Republic Gunship so it's good I didn't have to borrow his for my 2011 Jedi Display. I got it for free so the value for money is perfect for me. However retail prices are ridiculous, particularly here in New Zealand. The brown (yes BROWN) astromech droid is very cool. The ejector has received some mixed reviews. It does work as long as you push hard enough, and I find it works better if you have the cockpit on while you try to eject Plo. 
Overall I like this set and would reccomend it as long as you can get it for a good price.

author: legospongepotter
title: Great
review:
Okay, first, this is my first Star Wars ship. Also, it is my second set, my other is that Snowtrooper battle pack....but anyways, I'm not sure what to say about this since I'm new to Star Wars but I'll try my best!

Plo Koon - Pretty cool minifigure with good torso that is very detailed with back-printing and cool legs, plus these great plastic fangs on his head, a mix of orange and black. It is more rubbery than normal, but detailed. He comes with my first lightsaber, which is blue.

R2 D2 - Okay, I KNOW it is not R2 D2 but I can't remember his real name, but its something like that. He has the cool legs that allow him to rotate. Also the brown/white machine body that is made up of 4 pieces total.

Ship: Very nice blue/white ship with those sort of wing things that slant. My first set with anything like that. I like the back wing/rudder. There is a section for the R2 D2 machine and another area for Plo Koon that is covered with glass and has some computer pieces. The ship has lots of stickers and I just love the design, bigger than it looks. 

Overall: A great set, but I'm not experienced when it comes with Star Wars sets, but I like how it is designed. I would recommend it to a Star Wars fan and maybe City fans for some pieces. Good set for only 20 bucks.

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: Koh-To-Ya!
review:
Another year, another Jedi Starfighter. But this one is special. For one reason. Is it because of Plo Koon? No. Is it because of the lack of missiles? No.

This set contains the very first BROWN astro droid made by LEGO! Wow. Seriously, it took me by surprise. The R7-F5 droid looks red, but don't be fooled!

Anyway, enough of my warbling. On to the review!


Building the fighter - whew. Nothing we haven't seen before, but there were some pleasing touches. Firstly, the flick-fire missiles were absent. Maybe LEGO has given up on them, maybe not. Secondly, the ejector function is excellent if used properly. It takes a little time to get it right, but when you do, it's great fun lobbing Plo Koon across the room! Once more, the R7-F5 droid is great, and the look of the fighter is seriously cool.


And that brings me neatly to the Cons!

Getting the looks of the fighter right is all down to - you guessed it - STICKERS. Oh, by the Force. Remember the days of printed fuselage parts? Well, those days are dead and gone! The age of massive wedge stickers has been ushered in! Getting these right was an utter pain. Even the control panel was a sticker! The saving grace here was that the Republic symbol was printed! A bit late for that, LEGO!

Lastly, this set should have been released two years ago.


But this - even this - isn't enough to bring the model down that much. It's a good set; sure - it's nothing new on the vehicle front, but if you're a fan of Jedi heroics, you'll love this set.

-maaboo35!

author: Skyboss
title: Plo Koon's fighter. and a little less,
review:
I picked this up along with the droid tri-fighter. This set accurately depicts the starfighter used by Jedi master Plo Koon. Although it has some setbacks. No missiles, no blaster cannons like on other delta-7 b's. (yes that is the accurate fighter type)
Build: basically like the others, but lacing in details blaster cannon wise and missile launcher wise. Also has the ejector seat.
Parts: relatively normal and nothing special.
Minifigures: The set comes with Plo Koon and his astromech droid named R7-D4.
Over-all this set is good and is recommended you pick this up, although it will be around for a while most likely.

author: spacewars30
review: This was an o.k. set. Plo Koon's starfighter comes with of course Plo Koon who is only found in 1 other set, and R7-D4. This set was easy to build, and fun to play with. Other than that, it's not very good. This fighter is way to small for it's price. $24.99? Wow. The only pro about the ship itself is that it has something to hold on to Plo Koon's lightsaber. Hope you liked my review!

author: LegoAficionado
title: Great set, with great minifigs. Only downside...the price
review:
When I went to my local Toys'r'us to buy a few lego sets, I was not truly determined to pick this set up. But once I built the set and had a chance to play around with it, I was surprised to find that my initial reaction to the set had positively changed.

It costs $24.99, and for a 175 pieces, the set is not really worth the price, maybe a few dollars cheaper it would be. 

What the set is worth though, is the cool action feature and the Plo Kloon minifigure.

Now onto the review...

The Minifigs:
Master Plo Kloon is a very rare character to find in lego sets. He has probably only been in two sets including this one, so to have him is really nice. I really like the chrome lightsaber, a much needed improvement over the old silver ones. R7-D4 is my favorite astromech droid so far, because of the really nice and detailed design as well as the brown body piece, which you do not normally see.

The Starfighter:

The build was fun, and I personally really like the color scheme as well as the aesthetic design of the set. I know that this is pretty much the same build as the other jedi starfighter's in the star wars clone wars sets, but since I do not own any of the other starfighters of this kind, I enjoyed the build.

A lot of reviews that I have read elsewhere, have said that the action feature for the set, an ejector seat for Plo Kloon, does not work very well at all. After building the set and playing around with the feature for a while, I can safely say that I have NO idea what those reviewers are talking about. In my opinion, the ejector seat works perfectly! 
In further detail, the complaints have been that 1. Plo Kloon does not properly fit inside the compartment, and 2. that when you eject him, he just flops out of the ship. In response, 1. Plo Kloon does not wobble in his seat, though he does not necessarily fit snug onto the bricks, he does fit in the compartment, and plus if he were to fit snug in his seat, the ejector would not be able to remove him from the cockpit. 2. When Plo Kloon is ejected from the cockpit, he flies out, he does NOT flop out. 

Overall the main function of the set is flawless. I do wish there were some other functions, such as maybe one or two flickfire missiles or maybe a bomb drop compartment, but overall the ejector seat function is a welcome and original idea that I thoroughly enjoyed seeing from The Lego Group. 

Conclusion:

Pros:
  • -Master Plo Kloon and R7-D4
  • -Nice Ship design
  • -Awesome Ejector Seat function (flawless and original)
  • -Plenty of good pieces
Cons: 
  • -Price of $24.99 (should have been at least $15-20)
  • -For some, it might be the same build as the other starfighters from the  series
  • -No other functions besides the ejector seat
Overall: This set is not as bad as many have said it to be. The only off putting thing about the set is the price, and if you can get over that and build the set, I think you might enjoy it. I certainly was surprised by the set. The pros do outweigh most of the cons, so overall I give this set a 4/5.

author: tyuku57
title: THE SEPRATISTS ARE ATTACKING!
review:
[img]http://starwars.lego.com/en-us/Products/clonewars/8093.aspx[/img]This set is a nice sleek model that bares resemblence to the fighter on screen.

 

Pros

  • Plo Koon!
  • r7-d4
  • ejector seat
  • lightsaber holder
  • cannons

cons

  • no battle droids
  • STICKERS!

overall this set is a nice addition to the lego star wars collection.

author: MAK_REBAN
title: Very good
review:
This is a very good set and it has a lot of good things about it

Pros

  • Plo Koon and R7-D4 are very good
  • The ship is really good
  • Sturdy design
  • Lightsaber storage (Although it is outside...)

Cons

  • The ejector seat function isn't very good

Overall the set only has one con, and that can be solved by a very easy modification (take out the thing you push and just place a 2x2 brick in there), so in my eyes this set is worth getting, and I'm glad I got it.

author: arctrooper170
title: Legoman7777's Reviews: 8093 Plo Koon's Jedi Starfighter
review:
Hello everyone, this is my second review for the summer 2010 Star Wars sets. These reviews will be divided into 4 parts: Box, Build, Minifigures, and Set. Here we go.

Box: The box shows Plo Koon flying in his Starfighter away from a grassy planet and heading over a desert planet while being shot at from behind. At the bottom there is a choking warning label for the small ball piece included in the set. This is the second set to have the new dark blue design with Captain Rex on it. 

[img]http://www.flickr.com/photos/42493933@N05/4847341656/in/set-72157624499369337[/img]

Build: The build starts off by building the minifigures as always. Then it continues into the body of the Starfighter which has almost the same build as the last two Starfighters 7669 and 7751. The wings of the fighter are built last and have again almost the same build as the last two but with some modifications to the weaponry. 

Minifigures:

Plo Koon- He is exactly the same as he was in set 7676 Republic Attack Gunship. The only difference is that he has a new dull-chrome lightsaber hilt instead of the plain gray that he had previously. 

R7-D4- This is the all new astromech droid from the Clone Wars series. He is a basic white astromech droid with brown highlights except for his body which is fully brown with the details being white. I personally like him but honestly do not think that he completely matches with the bright colors of the fighter.


Set: Lastly we have the set, it is composed of Plo Koon's Jedi Starfighter. This fighter is brightly colored just as the one Plo Koon flies in both the Clone Wars series and in the end of Episode Three. It is very accurate only if you put the four stickers on the nose of the fighter. Those stickers can be a challenge if you're not very good with stickers. The main feature of the set is a mechanism to eject Plo Koon if he is about to crash or something like that. There is no ejection for his astromech droid though. 

I recommend this set to anybody who missed the first two jedi fighters or like the brightness of this one.

Watch my review of this set: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NWO6fOQazAc

Here is building the set, stop-motion style: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vGD2RbhuhUM

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: Awsome design!
review:
The Plo Koon's Jedi Starfighter set (8093) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2010. It comes with 2 minifigs and 175 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/8093-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

  • Plo Koon: Plo Koon has a head piece which is made out of rubber. He has a blue lightsaber and his basic Jedi torso.
  • R7-D4: This r2 unit is exclusive to this model at the moment. This droid has brown markings on the top and it's torso is printed brown too.
Jedi Starfighter:

The Jedi Starfighter has a very cool design. I like the combination with the white and the blue colors. There're a few decals which you have to put on. On the left side from the picture of the box you can see a handle for the lightsaber. You're able to take off the cockpit very easily and you can see the controls which reminds me of the scene from Star Wars Episode IV when Luke Skywalker attacked the Death Star. The wings are flexible and you can also move the landing gears. On the bottom you can see a button which you can push to shoot out the Jedi master. Plo Koon doesn't attach to the pegs but this makes this feature working. There's also a place to put in the r2 unit.

Positive:

Minifigures
Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOCs
Nice starter set
Design is attractive
You can push out Plo Koon!

Negative:

Price

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de/

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: gnat2u
title: REALLY COOL STARFIGHTER!
review:
really sturdy set that has good minifigs, awesome ejection funtion, and looks really cool.

pros

ejection seat

plo-koon and R7-D4

wings don't move

cons

fin stabalizers come off really easily

engines come off really easily

doesn't have missile launchers under wings.(Like earlier starfighters, which are more accurate in that section)

Summary

good set that is worth your money

author: Mandalorian
title: A beautiful Starfighter at a fairly affordable price.
review:
I have had this set basically since it was released. I loved it then and I love it now. It is big for it's price, things of similar size can be up to double the price these days. The colour scheme is beautiful, it forms a nice pattern on the fighter similar to the one in the Clone Wars. The shape is very sleek and it has fully retractable landing gear that looks great on the ground and is almost unnoticable in flight mode. The cockpit ejection seat works very well at expelling Plo Koon from the ship quite a long way (and the poor Droid stays behind to die). Despite having to go in sideways, the Astromech fits nicely into it's slot. This fighter has superb swooshability, probably better than any other set I own.
Pros:
  • Beautiful, sleek starfighter
  • Enjoyable building experience
  • Nice colours
  • Ejection seat works rather well.
  • Landing gear is awesome
  • Nice minifigures
  • Great price.

Cons:

  • Some stickers.

If you do not own this set, get it. At an affordable price, you get a ship that's very nice.

author: StratTone
title: I'm happy.
review: Never been a big A-wing fan but after building this set I'm leaning towards liking them.  My favorite things about this lego set is the ship itself, the build, and the figures.  I could take this one apart and build it over and over.

author: raycarnes
title: Well designed and easy to construct
review:
My son, 5 and a half, put this together with very little help from me.  He has the LEGO Starwars Wii game and found this a very exciting set to play with.  Plo Koon and R7-D4 enhance the authenticity of the design.

We picked it up at Toys"R"Us for $9.98 after buying another kit.  (It was prices at $19.95)

author: Chills
title: So many Jedi Starfighters, and you fell into my lap.
review:
I was given this set as a gift and while it wasn't on my "wanted" list I accepted it graciously. And I'm glad I did, its a pretty cool little set. Its my first Jedi Starfighter, and will likely be my last; but I'm glad to have one in my collection.

Pros

  • Pro 1: The build was fun. I like the use of bright colors in the pieces, especially the blue. I also like the old-school jet engine housings. I remember when those first came out on my passenger plane.
  • Pro 2: I'm not an expert in the prequel trilogy, but this set looks pretty close to the starfighter Plo Koon used in ROTS. So kudos to LEGO for an accurate set.
  • Pro 3: Good playability for a set this size. Its swooshable, has retractable landing gear, and Plo can be "blasted" out of his cockpit; just like the ill-fated Jedi was after Order 66 was given.
  • Pro 4: The minifigures are very cool. Plo Koon is only in 2 sets, so its nice to get him in a dedicated set.

Cons

  • Con 1: The set is a bit pricey for 175 pieces. But that's pretty common with SW license sets.
  • Con 2: Stickers... stickers... and more stickers. There are actually some tricky ones in this set: I found the front fuselage stickers tough to put on perfectly. If you want to avoid stickers avoid this set.

Overall I'm quite happy with this set. It rounds my collection with one Jedi Starfighter, and the minifigure looks like he's regular SW and not from the CW cartoon; a definite plus. The ship is full of bright colors and has good playability. The stickers are a con, but if you can get past those I would recommend this set.

author: darklighter66
title: Excellent addition to any collection
review: This is a quick easy set to build.  Definitely a must for any fan of Star Wars ships.  This is especially a cool set for anyone that is a fan of Plo Koon.  The mini figure is cool and looks good.  The ship is sleek and looks good with the blue pieces. Having the astromech droid sideways is interesting.  The only negative comments I have would be the stickers (not really a fan of putting these on any of my sets) and the clip on the side that holds the lightsaber (Not sure where else it would be put, but it's a little odd having it on the outside)
